definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To stop living ; to become dead ; to undergo death .

subdefinitions.definition: followed by of as an indication of direct cause; general use:
examples: He died of malaria.

subdefinitions.definition: followed by from as an indication of direct cause; general use, though somewhat more common in the context of medicine or the sciences:
examples: He died from heart failure.

subdefinitions.definition: followed by for ; often expressing wider contextual motivations, though sometimes indicating direct causes :
examples: He died for the one he loved.

subdefinitions.definition: ( now rare ) followed by with as an indication of direct cause:
( now sometimes proscribed ) followed by to as an indication of direct cause (like from ):
examples: I can't believe I just died to a turret !

subdefinitions.definition: ( still current ) followed by with as an indication of manner:
examples: She died with dignity.

subdefinitions.definition: ( in bare form ) to die in a certain form.
examples: Will I die a happy man?

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To ( stop living and) undergo (a specified death ).
examples: He died a hero's death.
They died a thousand deaths.

definitions.definition: ( video games , slang ) To lose or be eliminated from a game , particularly with a deathlike animation .
examples: Whenever my brother dies , he ragequits .
I'm dying for a packet of crisps.
I'm dying for a piss.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , uncommon , idiomatic ) To be or become hated or utterly ignored or cut off , as if dead .
examples: The day our sister eloped, she died to our mother.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , figuratively ) To become spiritually dead ; to lose hope .
examples: He died a little inside each time she refused to speak to him.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , colloquial , hyperbolic ) To be mortified or shocked by a situation.
examples: If anyone sees me wearing this ridiculous outfit, I'll die .

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , figurative , hyperbolic ) To be so overcome with emotion or laughter as to be incapacitated .
examples: When I found out my two favorite musicians would be recording an album together, I literally planned my own funeral arrangements and died .

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , of a machine ) To stop working ; to break down or otherwise lose "vitality".
examples: My car died in the middle of the freeway this morning.
Sorry I couldn't call you. My phone died .
My battery died and my charger was at home.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , of a computer program ) To abort , to terminate (as an error condition ).
( intransitive , of a legislative bill or resolution ) To expire at the end of the session of a legislature without having been brought to a vote .
examples: The proposed gas tax died after the powerful rural senator refused to let it out of committee.

definitions.definition: To perish ; to cease to exist ; to become lost or extinct .
To sink ; to faint ; to pine ; to languish , with weakness , discouragement , love , etc.
( often with "to" ) To become indifferent ; to cease to be subject .
examples: to die to pleasure or to sin

definitions.definition: ( architecture ) To disappear gradually in another surface , as where mouldings are lost in a sloped or curved face .
To become vapid , flat , or spiritless , as liquor .
( of a stand-up comedian or a joke , slang ) To fail to evoke laughter from the audience .
examples: Then there was that time I died onstage in Montreal...
